summary: This document is an email chain from November 16, 2020, between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and an Assistant United States Attorney. The primary subject is Sternheim's request to move her client, Maxwell, to a different cell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off, and a logistical discussion about delivering a laptop for Maxwell to review discovery materials.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to request her client be moved to a different cell due to facility maintenance and to discuss logistics for delivering a laptop for discovery review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated client of Bobbi C. Sternheim, held at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) under register number 02879-509. Her attorney is requesting she be moved from an isolation cell to an interior cell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An unnamed prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is coordinating with Maxwell's defense attorney regarding the logistics of delivering a laptop for discovery review and presumably receiving her requests regarding Maxwell's conditions.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as legal counsel for Maxwell, advocating for her living conditions and facilitating her access to discovery materials.
Professional correspondence between defense and prosecution regarding case logistics and defendant's welfare.

events.title: Attorney Request for Client Cell Transfer
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim emails the U.S. Attorney's office requesting her client, Ghislaine Maxwell, be moved from an isolation cell to an interior cell at MDC due to a scheduled water and heat shut-off by the NYC Dept. of Design & Construction.

events.title: Correction on Facility Shut-Off Information
events.description: An earlier email indicates the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) contacted the defense to state that the water and heat would not be shut off, contradicting the initial information Sternheim received.

events.title: Logistics Discussion for Discovery Laptop
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney requests a call to discuss the logistics of delivering a laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell for her to use when reviewing discovery materials.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) under register number 02879-509 as of November 2020.

Her defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, was actively advocating for her living conditions, specifically requesting a move from an isolation cell with two exterior walls to an interior cell due to a reported water and heat shut-off.
There was a court order permitting Maxwell to review discovery materials in a dayroom area cell from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm.
The prosecution and defense were coordinating the delivery of a laptop to Maxwell for the purpose of reviewing discovery materials for her case.
Conflicting information existed regarding facility maintenance, with the defense initially informed of a shut-off, but the BOP later stating it would not occur.
